intro: Stachyphrynium sinense, commonly known as the Chinese stachyphrynium, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces clusters of small, white flowers with a spathe and spadix. Its leaves are typically broad and arrow-shaped, with a smooth or slightly textured surface. Stachyphrynium sinense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as marshes and along stream banks.
